page.title: 02LOCAL NEWS
page.content: In the centre of the village of The Lea adjacent to the old disused road near the Old Mill there is a Building Plot offered for sale at Â£15,000. Also close by, the residents view with concern the Bohemian cum 'Gay' fraternity that appear to use Lea House as a Lodging house. The local farmers are very concerned about getting in the harvest, not only the grass as hay or as silage, that being the second crop but also the barley, wheat and the potato yield due to the atrocious Summer of rain and more rain. After twenty years there appears hope that The Lea Church of England (Voluntary Aided) Primary School will get a new classroom by the beginning of the new School Year in September. The Governors had hoped for an extension to the present School.
